bibliographic_metadata.Title: Three-dimensional mineral prospectivity mapping based on natural language processing and random forests: A case study of the Xiyu diamond deposit, China
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Guanyun Zhou, Jianping Chen, Wentong An, Chang Liu, Wei Li

abstract: This study presents a novel workflow for integrating geological text big data into three-dimensional mineral prospectivity mapping (3DMPM). Focusing on the Xiyu kimberlite-type diamond deposit in Shandong, China, exploration criteria were constructed using text mining technologies. A random forests classification model was applied to predict mineralization, demonstrating the effectiveness of the workflow in coupling geological data and knowledge.
key_points: Integration of geological text big data into 3D mineral prospectivity mapping.
Construction of exploration criteria using text mining technologies.
Application of random forests for mineralization prediction.
Demonstrated effectiveness of the workflow in geological data coupling.
